intro: Oncidium hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellow-green flowers with a distinctive white lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid environments. Oncidium hirtzii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining potting media. It is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice for orchid enthusiasts.
